author: realbigsean
content: There could be an issue with lighthouse serving old blocks. We prune old execution payloads and the query the EL for them on demand using the `eth_getBlockByHash` endpoint. I think we deserialize transactions at some point in there and we expect SSZ there still ‚Äî I haven‚Äôt updated this yet. I‚Äôll work on making this update but resyncing lighthouse node with `‚Äîprune-payloads false` might help in the mean time.

content: It could also be that someone (probably geth again) creates blocks with blob transactions in the block form if a reorg occurs and the blob transactions are reintroduced to the pool

author: terence0083
content:
Similar to Prysm we prune historical block and rebuild it later if requested by calling `eth_getBlockByHash` to EL client.
